research_field.ja: 無機物質、無機材料化学

affiliation.ja: 九州工業大学役員 学長

paper_title.en: Effect of thin film of molybdenum compounds on the corrosion of tinplate

description.en: Corrosion behavior of tinplates covered with the molybdenum compound film was investigated in organic acid solution. Specimens treated by pulsed current in the molybdate solution inhibited anodic and cathodic reactions in organic acid solution. Corrosion current densities of these specimens were lower than the specimen without treatment. Anodic or cathodic polarization, however, caused the pitting corrosion on surface of these specimens covered with molybdenum compounds. © The Electrochemical Society.

paper_title.en: Compositions and properties of pyrochlore-type oxides for air electrode in secondary cells

description.en: The electrochemical properties of pyrochlore-type oxides have been examined to develop the new catalyst for the air electrode of secondary cells. The electrode with Bi2lr2O7.z catalyst could reduce the overpotential for the oxygen reduction. By substituting with manganese for the B site of Bi2lr2O7-z catalyst, Bi 2Ir2.yMnyO7.z (y=0.3, 0.5, 1), the overpotential for the oxygen reduction reduced at the high current densities. Bi2Mn2O7.z catalyst may possess the ability for the oxygen reduction, even though this catalyst contains no iridium. The lifetime of the air electrodes with Bi2lr2.yMn yO7.z catalysts became shorter than that with Bi 2Ir2O7.z catalyst. ©The Electrochemical Society.

paper_title.en: Effects of preparation procedures and structure of IrO2-Ta 2O5 coated insoluble anodes on durability

description.en: The IrO2-Ta2O5 anodes for copper foil production were studied. As the thermal decomposition temperature of the catalytic layers becomes lower such as 613 K, no PbO2 deposits from the sulfuric solution containing lead ions. The short lifetime of these anodes can be improved by inserting the IrO2-Ta2O5 interlayer prepared at 743 K, because the adhesiveness between the catalytic layer and the titanium substrate becomes stronger. Another method to improve the lifetime is the etching process of the titanium substrate. New etching method in sulfuric acid also provides longer lifetime of the catalytic layer prepared at 613 K, on which no PbO2 deposits. © The Electrochemical Society.

paper_title.en: Titanium-based air electrodes for secondary air batteries

description.en: The charge-discharge properties of titanium-based air electrodes have been examined to develop the high durability cell with low overpotential for the oxygen evolution and reduction. In this study, iridium oxide or ruthenium oxide was coated on the titanium powders. Comparing to titanium-based electrode without the coating, twice or more coating with ruthenium oxide or iridium oxide induced the stable potential at charging and discharging during the cycle test. The discharge voltage, however, gradually decreased with cycles. XPS analysis indicated the formation of titanium oxide at charging, which caused the lifetime shorter. copyright The Electrochemical Society.

paper_title.ja: Electrodeposition of In-Sn Alloys in EMI-BF4-Cl Ambient Molten Salts

paper_title.en: Electrochemical reduction of tantalum compounds in ambient temperature melts

description.en: Electrodeposition of tantalum metal was investigated in BMP-TFSI ambient temperature melts, as well as electrochemistry of tantalum pentachloride. No tantalum compound deposits from the melt containing TaCl5. The addition of LiF forms the tantalum compounds on the tungsten electrode by potentiostatic method. From the BMP-TFSI melts containing TaCl5, LiF and BMPBr, tantalum metal could deposit at 353K, although the surface of deposits was rough and contained the impurities such as chlorides and fluorides. copyright The Electrochemical Society.

paper_title.en: Electrodeposition of In-Sn Alloys in EMI-BF4-Cl Ambient Molten Salts
Electrochemical reduction of tantalum compounds in ambient temperature melts

description.en: Electrodeposition of tantalum metal was investigated in BMP-TFSI ambient temperature melts, as well as electrochemistry of tantalum pentachloride. paper_title.ja: Electrodeposition of Indium-Tin Alloys from EMI・BF4・Cl Melts
paper_title.en: Electrodeposition of indium-tin alloys from EMI center dot BF4 center dot Cl melts

description.en: The electrodeposition of indium-tin alloys on a platinum electrode from EMI center dot BF4 center dot Cl melts was investigated by cyclic voltammetry and potentiostatic electrolysis. The cyclic voltammogram of the melt containing 0.1 mol kg(-1) InCl3 and 0.1 mol kg(-1) SnCl2 presented two broad reduction waves on the cathodic scan from a rest potential and three oxidation waves on the reverse scan. The electrodeposits obtained by potentiostatic electrolysis were found to be the mixture of tin and InSn4, of which the average mole ratio of indium contained in the electrodeposits increased with decreasing electrolysis potential in the range from -1.1 V to -1.4 V vs. Fe(III)/Fe(II).

paper_title.ja: Composition and Structure of Indium-Tin Alloys obtained from EMI・BF4・Cl Melts

paper_title.en: Electrodeposition of Indium-Tin Alloys from EMI, BF4, Cl Melts
Stability of iridium oxide-tantalum oxide coated titanium electrodes for oxygen evolution in alkaline solutions

description.en: A continuous anodic electrolysis of an iridium oxide-tantalum oxide (70:30 mol%) coated titanium electrode in a 4 mol dm(-3) NaOH solution were carried out to assess the electrode's durability. The electrode's potential during the electrolysis indicated that the potential was almost constant except at the end of electrolysis, which could be easily known with a drastic increase in potential. The electrode's lifetime under the same operation conditions was linearly dependent of the amount of the oxide coating. The compositional and morphological changes in the oxide coating during the electrolysis were studied by XRF and SEM. Both iridium oxide and tantalum oxide were rapidly consumed immediately after the electrolysis started, and then the consumption rates became small. The consumption of tantalum oxide was larger than that of iridium oxide so that the mole ratio of iridium oxide became higher than the initial value. The coating surface enriched with iridium oxide was also suggested by SEM observation. From the results obtained, the electrode was proven to have a high stability in such a concentrated alkaline solution comparable to that in an acidic solution.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF NEW MATERIALS FOR ELECTROCHEMICAL SYSTEMS

description.en: A continuous anodic electrolysis of an iridium oxide-tantalum oxide (70:30 mol%) coated titanium electrode in a 4 mol dm(-3) NaOH solution were carried out to assess the electrode's durability. The electrode's potential during the electrolysis indicated that the potential was almost constant except at the end of electrolysis, which could be easily known with a drastic increase in potential. The electrode's lifetime under the same operation conditions was linearly dependent of the amount of the oxide coating. The compositional and morphological changes in the oxide coating during the electrolysis were studied by XRF and SEM. Both iridium oxide and tantalum oxide were rapidly consumed immediately after the electrolysis started, and then the consumption rates became small. From the results obtained, the electrode was proven to have a high stability in such a concentrated alkaline solution comparable to that in an acidic solution.
